00001 //-*- mode:C++ ; c-basic-offset: 2 -*-
00002 #include "DF_Proj_Point.hpp"

00015     // class Point
00016     Point::Point(const vector<double> &uPosition,vector<string> &projArgs)
00017       : theUserCoords(uPosition),
00018         userDirty(true),
00019         mercDirty(false)
00020     {
00021       // Create the proj.4 stuff.  This is highly inefficient, as it should
00022       // live in the base class, not each object.  Fix that.
00023       
00024       char *mercator_argv[3]={"proj=merc",
00025                               "ellps=WGS84",
00026                               "lat_ts=0"};
00027 
00028       int numUserArgs = projArgs.size();
00029       char **user_argv = new char * [numUserArgs];
00030 
00031       for (int i=0; i<numUserArgs; ++i)
00032       {
00033         user_argv[i]=new char [projArgs[i].size()+1];
00034         projArgs[i].copy(user_argv[i],projArgs[i].size());
00035         // Null terminate the string!
00036         user_argv[i][projArgs[i].size()] = '\0';
00037       }
00038 
00039       if (!(userProj = pj_init(numUserArgs,user_argv)))
00040       {
00041         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize user projection"));
00042       }
00043       
00044       if (!(mercProj = pj_init(3,mercator_argv)))
00045       {
00046         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize mercator projection"));
00047       }
00048       
00049       // Don't bother trying to force the mercator --- we'll do that if
00050       // we query, because we're setting userDirty to true, just initialize
00051       // to junk.
00052       theMerc.resize(2,0.0);
00053       
00054     }
00055     
00056     Point::Point(const Point &right)
00057     {
00058 
00059       // Must *COPY* the definition, not the pointer to it!
00060       // Get the text version of the definition
00061       char *theProjDef = pj_get_def(right.userProj,0);
00062       // generate a new projUJ pointer
00063       userProj = pj_init_plus(theProjDef);
00064       free(theProjDef);
00065 
00066       theProjDef = pj_get_def(right.mercProj,0);
00067       // generate a new projUJ pointer
00068       mercProj = pj_init_plus(theProjDef);
00069       free(theProjDef);
00070 
00071       if (right.mercDirty)
00072       {
00073         // Right's mercator's been changed without its LL being 
00074         // updated, so copy its mercator values and say we're dirty.
00075         theMerc=right.theMerc;
00076         mercDirty=true;
00077         userDirty=false;
00078       } 
00079       else
00080       {
00081         // Just copy its LL and mark dirty.
00082         theUserCoords=right.theUserCoords;
00083         userDirty=true;
00084         mercDirty=false;
00085       }
00086     }
00087 
00088     Point::~Point()
00089     {
00090       pj_free(userProj);
00091       pj_free(mercProj);
00092     }
00093 
00094     Point& Point::operator=(const Point& rhs)
00095     {
00096       if (this == &rhs) return *this;
00097 
00098       if (userProj) 
00099       {
00100         pj_free(userProj);
00101         userProj=0;
00102       }
00103       if (mercProj)
00104       {
00105         pj_free(mercProj);
00106         mercProj=0;
00107       }
00108 
00109       char *theProjDef = pj_get_def(rhs.userProj,0);
00110       // generate a new projUJ pointer
00111       userProj = pj_init_plus(theProjDef);
00112       free(theProjDef);
00113 
00114       theProjDef = pj_get_def(rhs.mercProj,0);
00115       // generate a new projUJ pointer
00116       mercProj = pj_init_plus(theProjDef);
00117       free(theProjDef);
00118 
00119       mercDirty=rhs.mercDirty;
00120       userDirty=rhs.userDirty;
00121 
00122       return (*this);
00123     }
00124 
00125     void Point::setXY(const vector<double> &mPosition)
00126     {
00127       theMerc = mPosition;
00128       // Essential to set userDirty=false, otherwise getXY will try to 
00129       // convert ll and we'll be wrong.
00130       mercDirty=true;  
00131       userDirty=false;
00132     }
00133 
00134     void Point::setUserProj(vector<string> &projArgs)
00135     {
00136       int numUserArgs = projArgs.size();
00137       char **user_argv = new char * [numUserArgs];
00138       for (int i=0; i<numUserArgs; ++i)
00139       {
00140         user_argv[i]=new char [projArgs[i].size()+1];
00141         projArgs[i].copy(user_argv[i],projArgs[i].size());
00142       }
00143       if (!(userProj = pj_init(numUserArgs,user_argv)))
00144       {
00145         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize user projection"));
00146       }
00147     }      
00148     
00149     const vector<double> & Point::getXY()
00150     {
00151       if (userDirty)
00152       {
00153         // our LL has been changed, so update
00154         userToMerc();
00155       }
00156       return(theMerc);
00157     }
00158 
00159     void Point::setUserCoords(const vector<double> &llPosition)
00160     {
00161       theUserCoords = llPosition;
00162       // If we set ll, must now trump mercator.
00163       userDirty=true; mercDirty=false;
00164     }
00165 
00166     const vector<double> & Point::getUserCoords()
00167     {
00168       if (mercDirty)
00169       {
00170         // our LL has been changed, so update
00171         mercToUser();
00172       }
00173       return(theUserCoords);
00174     }
00175     
00176     Point * Point::Clone()
00177     {
00178       Point *retPoint;
00179       retPoint = new Point(*this);
00180       return retPoint;
00181     }
00182 
00183     void Point::userToMerc()
00184     {
00185       projUV data;
00186       double z;
00187       if (pj_is_latlong(userProj))
00188       {
00189         data.u = theUserCoords[0]*DEG_TO_RAD;
00190         data.v = theUserCoords[1]*DEG_TO_RAD;
00191       }
00192       z=0;
00193       if (pj_transform(userProj,mercProj,1,0,&(data.u),&(data.v),&z) != 0)
00194       {
00195         throw(Util::Exception("Failure converting user coords to Mercator"));
00196       }
00197 
00198       theMerc.resize(2);
00199       theMerc[0]=data.u;
00200       theMerc[1]=data.v;
00201 
00202       userDirty=false;
00203     }      
00204 
00205 
00206     void Point::mercToUser()
00207     {
00208       projUV data;
00209       double z;
00210       data.u = theMerc[0];
00211       data.v = theMerc[1];
00212       z=0;
00213       if (pj_transform(mercProj,userProj,1,0,&(data.u),&(data.v),&z) != 0)
00214       {
00215         throw(Util::Exception("Failure converting Mercator to LL"));
00216       }
00217       theUserCoords.resize(2);
00218       if (pj_is_latlong(userProj))
00219       {
00220         theUserCoords[0]=data.u*RAD_TO_DEG;
00221         theUserCoords[1]=data.v*RAD_TO_DEG;
00222       }
00223       mercDirty=false;
00224     }      
00225   }
